intro: Werauhia lyman-smithii, commonly known as the Lyman-Smith's werauhia, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This plant is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that surround its small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in the canopy of rainforests. The plant's botanical features make it a popular subject in botanical gardens and for plant enthusiasts.
